sentences.en: " Nice clothes invite pointing fingers, High climbers god's good will defy. "
sentences.cn: 美服患人指, 高明 逼神恶.

sentences.en: Fierce - browed , I coolly defy a thousand pointing fingers ; headbowed , like a willing ox I serve the children.
sentences.cn: 横眉冷对千夫指, 俯首甘为孺子牛.
她的标准让人搞不明白。

sentences.en: I defy them to do their worse!
I defy you to come up with one major accomplishment of the current Prime Minister.
sentences.cn: 我敢说你讲不出现任首相的哪怕一项重大成就。

sentences.en: I defy you to jump that high hurdle.
sentences.cn: 我倒要看看你能不能跳过那高栏.

sentences.en: I feel he may defy us there.
sentences.cn: 我想我们是搞不过他的.

sentences.en: If you defy the law, you may find yourself in prison.
sentences.cn: 如果你不服从法律, 你就可能会坐牢.

sentences.en: Let them do their worst! ( I defy them to do their worse! )
sentences.cn: 让他们蛮干好 啦 ( 我不相信他们敢蛮干 )!

sentences.en: No boy should ever defy his parents.
sentences.cn: 小孩不应违抗他的父母.

sentences.en: people who openly defy the law
The singer continues to defy her age by wearing the scantiest of outfits.
sentences.cn: 那名女歌手依旧穿着非常暴露的服装，完全不似她这把岁数。

sentences.en: The towering pine and cypress trees defy frost and snow.
They defy accurate classification at present.
sentences.cn: 这使目前的正确分类有困难.

sentences.en: They defy difficulties and advance wave upon wave.
sentences.cn: 他们不怕困难,前扑后继.

sentences.en: This was the first (and last) time that I dared to defy my mother.
sentences.cn: 这是我第一次（也是最后一次）胆敢违抗我母亲。

trans.tran_cn: 违抗，激，经受住，难以（描述或理解）
trans.tran_en: to refuse to obey a law or rule, or refuse to do what someone in authority tells you to do

trans.tran_cn: 违抗， 蔑视； 使成为不可能； 惹， 激
trans.tran_en: If you defy someone or something that is trying to make you behave in a particular way, you refuse to obey them and behave in that way
